subject: Management
title: The Five-Part Handoff
description: A quick win: understand The Five-Part Handoff.

hook.text: A project failed because the manager said 'just handle it' with no other guidance.

buildup.text: Every delegation needs five things: outcome, deadline, authority, resources, and check-in points.

discovery.text: The five-part handoff prevents 80% of delegation failures before they start.

twist.text: Most managers skip at least two of the fiveâ€”usually authority and check-in points.

climax.text: Spending three minutes on a clear handoff saves three weeks of rework.

punchline.text: Clarity at the start prevents chaos at the end.

quiz.question: Which is NOT one of the five handoff components?
options: The manager's personal opinion on approach
The authority level and resources available
